reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For our first trip to Berlin, our aim was to be in Berlin-Mitte with easy access to the cultural highlights. The Regent seemed to be a quiet hotel with a view on the Gendarmenmarkt. This was actually the case: the hotel was extremely quiet even so it was the week-end of the 20th reunification anniversary and we were granted a room with a view (see related picture).
reviews.title: The cold elegance of the East

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Room and bathroom were big, comfortable, elegant and well maintained. It was a cold and wet week-end and it was a big relief to run back to get into the big, nice tub for a hot bath after having been totally showered !
reviews.title: Unacceptable foul-ups for upscale luxury hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Easy check-in and out.
reviews.title: Top end hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009
reviews.text: The reason why we give 4 stars rather than 5 is that we could not make out any atmosphere and warmth. If this is a minor issue to you, then certainly we would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Luxury in a superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has all the attributes of a luxury hotel - fabulous location (Charlottenstrasse - a block from the Unter den Linden, near Bradenburg gate, Deutsches & Holocaust museum etc.), fully appointed rooms, luxury bathrooms and awesome food and service in its restaurants.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay at the Regent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a lovely weekend in Belin and the stay at the Regent was great. This was already my second time there. The location is perfect and this time I got a room at the 8th floor. Rooms are really big and confortable with complimentary Wireles Internet and DVD player. Just the TV is a little bit old - they could do better with Flatscreen.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Bathroom is huge, very clean, towels and bathrobes very confortable.
reviews.title: First class hotel in Berlin

likes.disliked: — I never found anything to complain about.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is delicious, with a large selection of hot dishes and sweets that are brought to you so you do not have to stand up the whole time.
reviews.title: East Berlin's finest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and efficient employees at the reception desk, concierge and porter. Also housekeeping was very friendly. Complimentary shoe cleaning worked great!
reviews.title: A lovely gem

likes.liked: — The service, general ambiance and location.
likes.disliked: — The decor in the rooms was a little tired.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fitness and sauna are small but nice. Pity that they do not have a swimming pool.
reviews.title: Top End of 5 Star Deluxe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 5 days at the Regent Berlin. It was absolutely perfect...... and I highly recommend staying here for an experience that will enhance your vacation.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel.......Best Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are exceptional. Everyone is very knowledgeable and friendly. They are extremely accommodating. The rooms are oversized and impeccably clean. The location gives easy access to restaurants, sites, public transit as well an easy walk to many locations.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed with the Regent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for a weekend in October at the Regent in Berlin to celebrate my 40th birthday. We chose this hotel after reading reviews, knowing it was a Four Seasons and looking at the website which says the Regent is 'deemed as one of the best places to stay in the world'.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived late on Friday evening after a day at work and flying from the UK to Berlin. We were looking forward to arrive at the hotel but, now, I cannot find the right words to express my disappointment.
reviews.title: Best Room and service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Firstly, we were given the electronic key to the room , but it did not work and we needed help from staff to get in. They repaired the mechanism the following day.
reviews.title: Excellent But a Bit Uninspired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel worthy of its 5 stars
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a deluxe room and had a very cosy one with a nice view on Gendarmenmarkt
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom was large & great (pink marble, separate bath tub and shower, choice of care products, etc ...)
reviews.title: Cost saving program at The Regent Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room spacious & comfortable (large flat TV, even a DVD player)
reviews.title: Elegance elevates this establishment beyond its superior offerings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It seems there's a nice fitness room but I didn't use it
reviews.title: Wonderful but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I chose the Regent for this trip based on its high Trip Advisor ratings, but on my next trip, I'll go around the corner to the Adlon, which is my favorite in Berlin, especially in terms of the pool, spa, and rooms. The Regent is a very solid choice and certainly has well-turned out common areas, but I found the Adlon to be a clear notch above in terms of both the room and the amenities.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family (2 adults and our 13-yr old daughter) stayed at the Regent Berlin for 3 nights in early August. Our experience at this hotel was terrific, and we’d definitely rate it at 5 stars.
reviews.title: In its own league

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a deluxe room online via the hotel web site and requested an early check in. The following day, I received an email from the hotel asking about our desired check-in time. Sure enough, when we arrived at the hotel at 11 AM, our room was ready.
reviews.title: Divine!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was spacious with elegant furnishings and comfortable beds. Even with a king bed and a roll-away for our daughter, there was plenty of space in the room. The marble bathroom was also very nice, with a separate shower and tub and the toilet in its own room. Free internet access is also a nice feature at this hotel.
reviews.title: european elegance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had been booked into the Ritz for the Easter weekend, but I saw a special deal on the Regent website (Euro164 per night) so switched the booking here. Best decision I have made in years. From start to finish, the stay was faultless. It was our anniversary and the hotel kindly upgraded our room to the top floor, and provided some chocolate dipped stawberries, profiteroles and half a bottle of champagne to help us celebrate. Wonderful.
reviews.title: Superb - would not stay anywhere else in Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was huge, the bed a super king size, smooth beautiful sheets on the bed, housekeeping twice a day (and we were out at different times each day, but the staff managed each time to have the room done when we were out without us telling them our movements), L'Occitane toiletries refreshed constantly, interesting platters each day (one day dates and plums with chocolates, the next day a very generous Easter chocolate display), large marble bathroom with separate shower and bath, and (best of all) a separate toilet so that if you are bathing, the toilet is not "out of service" for your partner. The block out curtains in the bedroom were some of the best I have ever seen in a hotel room - meaning we slept in most days longer than we should have! There were two huge double cupboards with lots of good quality hangers (the real sort of hanger, not those annoying ones that clip into holders so that you feel as though the hotel is expecting you to steal everything!), robes and slippers, all the toiletries and cotton wool, sewing kits, emery boards you could need. Free shoe shine every night.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were some of the most pleasant I have come across, the concierge always helpful and friendly, the location right next to Gendarmenmarkt very central to all the sights and the tube stops. Why stay anywhere else?
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not use the bar or restaurant, but both looked lovely. There is a central courtyard where you can sit outside for lunch or a snack and enjoy the weather in season.
reviews.title: Berlin revisited

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the television is an older style CRT one, but it is kept in a lovely cabinet, so why would the hotel upgrade to a flat screen? The room is more than big enough to be able to handle the size of the furniture. There was free wifi.
reviews.title: Better than we expected

likes.disliked: — Newt Gingrich was there at the same time

reviews.title: Not 5 star as we know it
reviews.text: During early August, the hotel was not at all crowded and much of the time we felt like we had the whole hotel to ourselves. The staff was always very polite, professional and friendly. There is a very nice fitness center on the lower level of the hotel, although we preferred to run outside and take advantage of the nice weather and beautiful location. The doormen always had towels and bottled water for us when we returned from our morning run.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved The Regent Berlin Hotel!!! Everybody was so pleasant and always smiling, from the moment we walked in, to the time of check-out.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was perfect, partly “a la carte”, with a huge variety of things to choose from, all included in the rate! (- I like this idea of “a la carte” as it doesn’t permit as much waste of food as the buffet breakfasts. When I see those large buffets, I notice that people tend to put much more on their plates then they can eat; for me it’s a shame the quantity of good, fresh, healthy food being thrown into the garbage!)
reviews.title: It's all true

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfect too, so one can walk to most of the important sites or take the subway that is a stone throw away.
reviews.title: The Regent Berlin demonstrates what a five star luxury hotel is all about.
Flawless in all respects
reviews.text: The room is large, very nicely decorated, impeccable, freshly painted and with white crisp linens and fluffy towels.
